channel.title: Engineering on Fly-Out
channel.description: Recent content in Engineering on Fly-Out

item.title: Who I am?
item.description: This page is an informal bio, my professional CV is available here. *My name is V. since my birth in the 80’s. Why do I remain anonymous? Simply, to live happily, let’s live hidden. Internet is full of surprises, good and bad. One of the simplest ways to protect yourself from bad surprises and to stay hidden. I argue this choice by the following analysis: You know me in one way or another, and in this case, it is useless for me to give you this information again, Either a search engine has brought you here, in which case knowing my identity is of no immediate interest.

item.title: Eureka An old Fashion Equation Solver
item.description: During my studies (several years ago), I discovered the Equation solver TkSolver. Some days ago, I was trying to find a GNU equivalent to TkSolver as I wanted to perform some computations. My searches were unsuccessful (not exactly but I didn’t find a similar tool) but I found Eureka Solver which is an old solver (may be the first of this type). Eureka Solver (and TK solver) is build on the declarative programming approach while the « standard » solvers use a procedural approach.
